items.title: Kafka in Kameroen: bondscoach Brys niet ontslagen, maar ook niet op de Afrika Cup
items.summary: Kameroen is onder leiding van trainer David Pagou afgereisd naar Marokko, waar de ploeg woensdag aan de Afrika Cup begint. De soap met bondscoach Marc Brys gaat tegelijkertijd onverminderd verder: de Vlaming stelt dat hij nog altijd geen communicatie heeft gehad waaruit blijkt dat hij niet langer de keuzeheer is.

items.title: Genk stelt na afzegging Hoefkens nieuwe hoofdtrainer aan
items.summary: RC Genk heeft een nieuwe hoofdtrainer gevonden. De Belgische club, die eerder zonder succes een lijntje uitwierp naar NAC-coach Carl Hoefkens, maakt via de offici√´le website melding van de komst van Nicky Hayen.

items.title: Buijs hamert op noodzaak van versterking voor Fortuna: 'In elke linie √©√©n'
items.summary: Danny Buijs is van mening dat de selectie van Fortuna Sittard in januari een kwaliteitsimpuls nodig heeft, om in de tweede seizoenshelft de huidige lijn te kunnen voortzetten. In de ogen van de trainer loopt zijn huidige spelersgroep op het tandvlees.

items.title: Dalot: Fernandes injury 'massive' blow to Utd
items.summary: Diogo Dalot called Bruno Fernandes' injury a "massive" blow as Manchester United wait to find out the severity of the skipper's setback.

items.title: Serie A now scraps plan for match in Australia
items.summary: Plans to play a Serie A match between AC Milan and Como in Australia next month have been abandoned.

items.title: Kane smashes Arjen Robben record in Bayern rout
items.summary: Harry Kane scored his 30th club goal of the season as Bayern Munich shrugged off an injury and illness crisis to sweep past Heidenheim 4-0 on Sunday and go into the Bundesliga's winter break with a nine-point lead.

items.summary: 'Rapid' Ricky Evans produced a "box-office" display as he dumped out seventh seed James Wade in a World Championship classic at Alexandra Palace on Monday.

items.title: Milan‚Äôs Serie A match in Australia called off after ‚Äòunacceptable requests‚Äô
items.summary: Milan-Como was intended for Perth on 8 February Asian Football Confederation wanted to impose conditions The proposal to play a Serie A match between Milan and Como in Perth, Australia, has been cancelled due to football sanctions and conditions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC). The game was set to become the first major European domestic league fixture to be played outside its home country but will now not go ahead because of the financial risks and last-minute complications. items.title: Rav van den Berg kent zijn straf voor zeer opmerkelijke rode kaart
items.summary: Rav van den Berg kan FC K√∂ln de komende twee wedstrijden niet helpen. De Zwollenaar kreeg zaterdag in de wedstrijd tegen Union Berlin een opmerkelijke rode kaart, maandag werd zijn straf bekend.

items.title: Wolves‚Äô freefall leaves even Derby‚Äôs misery within reach
items.summary: A side that once looked resilient has collapsed into historic futility, with Wolves now facing the grim task of avoiding the worst season English league football has ever seen Saturday‚Äôs defeat at home to Brentford means Wolves have taken just two points for 17 games. No side in the entire history of English league football, in any division, has ever made a worse start than that. To reach 11 points, the record low for a Premier League season set by Derby County in 2007-08, would require a significant improvement. How can this have happened? Wolves finished 16th last season, recovering after a dismal start. When Vitor Pereira took over on 19 December last year, they were second bottom on nine points from 16 games. They picked up 23 points from the final 22 games of the season and effectively ended any prospect of relegation with a run of six successive victories in the spring. How can a team go from averaging near enough a point a game to a tenth of that? The drop-off is extraordinary. This is an extract from Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly look from the Guardian US at the game in Europe and beyond. Subscribe for free here. Have a question for Jonathan? Email soccerwithjw@theguardian.com, and he‚Äôll answer the best in a future edition. Continue reading...

items.title: Milan agree loan deal for Niclas F√ºllkrug as West Ham look to sign new striker
items.summary: Milan have option to buy German at end of season West Ham interested in Wolves‚Äôs J√∏rgen Strand Larsen Milan have agreed to sign West Ham‚Äôs Niclas F√ºllkrug on loan with an option to buy at the end of the season. The Germany striker has toiled since moving to the London Stadium from Borussia Dortmund for ¬£27.5m in the summer of 2024 and it is hoped that his exit will free up funds for Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo to boost his side‚Äôs fight against relegation by bringing in a new forward during next month‚Äôs transfer window. West Ham are interested in Wolves‚Äôs J√∏rgen Strand Larsen but are reluctant to meet his valuation. It is believed that Wolves, who are bottom of the Premier League, want ¬£40m for the Norwegian. West Ham‚Äôs budget is limited and they feel that the package for Strand Larsen, who has scored once in the league this season, is too expensive. Continue reading...
